page.title: 18 WOODLAND NEAR WOODBRIDGE.
page.content: There are only small areas of Woodland in this part of Suffolk. The Woods we walked through were desciduous trees, mostly oak and sycamore. The Sycamore trees are often cut so they don't grow very tall. The saplings are used to make hurdles for the sheep farm. The farmer makes them into pens to collect his sheep together. In the middle of the woods is a small cottage where an old lady lives alone. She used to draw her water from a well by her front door. We saw her pump which still works. Now she has a tap in her kitchen.She has to walk 500 metres each day - to fetch her milk from the gate at the edge of the woods.She told us she likes living in the woods and watching the squirrels scampering up the trees surrounding her house.
